Leo Tolstoy was a Russian writer, philosopher, and social critic. He is considered one of the greatest novelists in the history of world literature. He is best known for his novels War and Peace and Anna Karenina.

Alexander Pushkin was a Russian poet, novelist, playwright, and short story writer. He is considered to be one of the greatest Russian writers of all time.

Stephen King is an American author of horror, fantasy, science fiction, suspense, and supernatural fiction. He is the author of more than fifty books, eight of which have been adapted into films.
King was born in Portland, Maine, on September 21, 1947. He grew up in the small town of Bangor, Maine, where he attended high school. King graduated from Bangor High School in 1965 and attended the University of Maine at Orono, where he studied English literature.
King began his writing career in the early 1970s, publishing his first novel, Carrie, in 1974. Since then, he has become one of the most successful and well-known authors in the world.
